body_html:
It appears that your code BlockFilter::getFrame seems to create a Tensor, populate it with 16 elements, and then call tensor.scalar<float>() on it.

I suspect this can be fixed once you change the getFrame() to not call scalar<>(). (If you need to access the i-th element, call flat<T>()(i).)
body_text:
It appears that your code BlockFilter::getFrame seems to create a Tensor, populate it with 16 elements, and then call tensor.scalar<float>() on it.
I suspect this can be fixed once you change the getFrame() to not call scalar<>().  (If you need to access the i-th element, call flat<T>()(i).)
body:
It appears that your code `BlockFilter::getFrame` seems to create a `Tensor`, populate it with 16 elements, and then call `tensor.scalar<float>()` on it.  

I suspect this can be fixed once you change the `getFrame()` to not call `scalar<>()`.  (If you need to access the `i`-th element, call `flat<T>()(i)`.)
